headline.print_headline: Survey Puts New Focus on Binge Eating as a Diagnosis
headline.main: Survey Puts New Focus on Binge Eating as a Diagnosis

docs.lead_paragraph: Binge eating is more common than anorexia and bulimia, but is not yet officially classified as a psychiatric disorder.

headline.print_headline: Pressing To Look Closer At Blood Clots And the Pill
headline.main: Pressing to Look Closer at Blood Clots and the Pill

docs.lead_paragraph: For more than a decade, scientists have argued whether newer oral contraceptives cause certain types of blood clots more often than their predecessors.
docs.snippet: For more than a decade, scientists have argued whether newer oral contraceptives cause certain types of blood clots more often than their predecessors.

headline.main: Survey Puts New Focus on Binge Eating as a Diagnosis

docs.abstract: Dr James I Hudson of Harvard University leads study on eating disorders that finds binge eating to be more prevalent than anorexia nervosa and bulimia; research, which is published in journal Biological Psychiatry, suggests that when binge eating involves loss of control by patient rather than choice it becomes psychiatric condition; binge eating is not currently recognized in Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, American Psychiatric Association's diagnostic bible; drawing (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: Binge eating is not yet officially classified as a psychiatric disorder. But it may be more common than the two eating disorders now recognized, anorexia nervosa and bulimia. The first nationally representative study of eating disorders in the United States, a nationwide survey of more than 2,900 men and women, was published by Harvard researchers in the Feb. 1 issue of the journal Biological Psychiatry. It found a prevalence in the general population of 0.6 percent for anorexia, 1 percent for bulimia and 2.8 percent for binge-eating disorder.
docs.snippet: Binge eating is not yet officially classified as a psychiatric disorder. But it may be more common than the two eating disorders now recognized, anorexia nervosa and bulimia.     The first nationally representative study of eating disorders in the...

headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Approves an Over-the-Counter Version of the Weight-Loss Drug Xenical

docs.lead_paragraph: Experts expect the drug, Alli, to be available to consumers in the summer without a prescription.
